I don't think people would take kindly to us doing a fictional play on it. It's sort of a nonstarter because of the subject. Donald Rumsfeld would likely be willing to look at a script if it were another subject matter, he said. " again, Betty White quips, "I think you do a thing once and then you run like a thief." David Letterman then asks her what she does in her free time and Betty White says, Oh, I like to do most anything. Play with animals, mostly. And vodka's kind of a hobby. So David Letterman reaches down from behind the desk and produces a bottle of Grey Goose, to which Betty White laughs heartily. They share some vodka, then she does a classic spit-take. Welcome to the 112th Congress. American people-- this is your week. this capacity that Donald Rumsfeld met with Saddam Hussein in 1983- an event that Donald Rumsfeld uses to kick off the book. Donald Rumsfeld archly notes that the encounter, at which he was filmed shaking Saddam Hussein 's hand, would become the subject of gossip, rumors, and crackpot conspiracy theories for more than a quarter of a century. In Donald Rumsfeld 's telling, the whole business was a fairly straightforward case of great-power politics.
